data.title: Expreso de La Robla: From Bilbao to León 2024
data.meta_description: Expreso de La Robla, Bilbao to León (3 days) itinerary, departures and rates.
data.text:
Bilbao - Frías - Espinosa de los Monteros (Friday)

Baggage pick up at 14:00 hrs. at the Bilbao train station "La Concordia". At 15:00 hrs. the reception of the whole group will take place on board the train. Once settled in, Expreso de La Robla sets off for Espinosa de Los Monteros. With the coach, arrival and visit of the town of Frías, whose urban center preserves its medieval layout and atmosphere, and the Tobera waterfalls, a place with a special charm. Dinner and overnight in Espinosa de los Monteros, a beautiful village in the Merindades region of Burgos.

Bilbao (Basque Country)

Bilbao, a cosmopolitan city full of life that has evolved towards modernity without losing its traditional identity. Famous not only for its "Cathedral of Santiago", declared a World Heritage Site in 2015, but also for its Guggenheim Museum, considered one of the most important works of the contemporary world for its beauty and great cultural value. City of exquisite dishes such as tripe a la vizcaína, squid in its ink, or desserts such as carolinas. Read more

Espinosa de los Monteros - Románico Palentino - Cistierna (Saturday)

Breakfast on board while we arrive with the train to Mataporquera. From here, our coach will take us to the splendid landscapes of the Románico Palencia in the middle of the Camino de Santiago: Carrión de los Condes, of medieval origin and that is evident in some of its monuments and in its old town. Frómista, capital of the Románico Palencia and Saldaña, a town known for its great architectural heritage and rich history.

We will tour the town and enjoy some free time before continuing our route visiting the Canal de Castilla, which is one of the most important engineering works of its time and its construction lasted almost a century, and the Romanesque church of San Martin. Free time and lunch. In the afternoon, we will go back in time with a visit to the Roman Villa of La Olmeda and its spectacular collection of mosaics. Back on the train, the Expreso de La Robla will take us to Cistierna, the beautiful, green and picturesque Cistierna. Dinner and overnight on board the train.

Carrión de Los Condes (Castilla y León)

Carrión de los Condes, a city of pilgrimage, is located in Castilla y León. Its population is just over 2,000 inhabitants. It has a continentalized Mediterranean climate, with cold winters with frequent frosts and mild but dry summers. Its average temperature reaches 12°C. Read more

Fromista (Castilla y León)

Frómista, also known as Villa del Milagro, is located in the province of Palencia in Castilla y León. It has a population of 770 inhabitants. It has a continentalized Mediterranean climate, which triggers mild summers and cold winters with regular frosts. Its average temperature is 12°C. Read more

Cistierna (Castilla y León)

Beautiful, green and picturesque city, where the visitor can enjoy its tranquility in nature, besides visiting places like "La Ermita de San Guillermo", where it houses a beautiful altarpiece of the seventeenth century. Another place of interest to take into account is the Church of Santa Maria, currently its Cultural Exhibition Center. In Cistierna you will be able to taste delicious dishes such as its cocido montañés, typical of the region. Read more
